headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Memory Boost
summary: The report, which was released later than normal because of the shutdown, said that consumer prices rose 2.7% in November from a year earlier.  Micron led the S&P 500 with a 10% jump for the day, while Sandisk and chip equipment maker Lam Research were the other top gainers on the index by the close.

headline: Tesla’s ‘Musk Premium’ in Focus With SpaceX IPO on the Horizon
summary: The problem is there’s only one way to buy into his vision: Tesla Inc.’s stock.  The rally is a testament to Wall Street’s faith in Musk’s artificial intelligence ambitions, particularly since Tesla’s core auto business is struggling.  “The valuation doesn’t make any sense,” said Vikram Rai, portfolio manager and macro trader at First New York, which sold its Tesla position earlier this year after Musk and President Donald Trump had a very public fallout over social media.

headline: Amazon, Apple, Google, etc.: Why the Mag 7 needs to 'recalibrate'
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is concentrated primarily in the top ten technology stocks, according to Barclays. PNC Asset Management Group chief investment officer Amanda Agati, Yahoo Finance Senior Business Reporter Ines Ferré, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to discuss the market's concentration in tech and whether it's time for investors to start selling the "Magnificent Seven." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Apple announces changes to iOS in Japan
summary: CUPERTINO, Calif., December 18, 2025--Apple® today announced changes impacting iOS apps in Japan to comply with the Mobile Software Competition Act (MSCA). These updates create new options for developers to distribute apps on alternative app marketplaces and to process app payments for digital goods and services outside of Apple In-App Purchase. Across these changes, Apple has worked to reduce new privacy and security risks the law creates to provide users in Japan the best and safest experience

raw.headline: Apple announces changes to iOS in Japan

Across these changes, Apple has worked to reduce new privacy and security risks the law creates to provide users in Japan the best and safest experience
